intro: Krascheninikovia rhaphanorrhiza, commonly known as the Antarctic hairgrass, is a flowering plant native to the cold environments of Antarctica and southern South America. It is a low-growing perennial grass that thrives in extreme conditions, characterized by its ability to survive in nutrient-poor soils and harsh climates. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in dense spikelets, typical of the Poaceae family. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid conditions. Krascheninikovia rhaphanorrhiza plays a crucial role in stabilizing soil and supporting local ecosystems in its polar and subpolar habitats.
